visual
Class VisualSpectrogramAudioFile

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              visual.VisualSpectrogram
                  visual.VisualSpectrogramAudioFile
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ComponentListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, visual.FrameChanger, visual.Visualizer
public class VisualSpectrogramAudioFile
extends VisualSpectrogram
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, visual.Visualizer, java.awt.event.ComponentListener, visual.FrameChanger

VisualSpectrogramAudioFile implements a visualization of the spectrogram processing a given buffered audio file

Author:
sidoneum, sifeluga
See Also:
Serialized Form

constructor

Parameters:
bas - reference to global audio file storage
fromSample - the first sample, starting point
nSamples - how many samples should be read
startComponentSize - startSize of JComponent (setPreferredSize(..))

Parameters:
bas - reference to global audio file storage
fromSample - the first sample, starting point
nSamples - how many samples should be read
windowLength - length of the window in ms
windowShift - shift of the window in ms

VisualSpectrogramAudioFile

public VisualSpectrogramAudioFile(visual.BufferedAudioSource bas,
                                  double contrast,
                                  int fromSample,
                                  int nSamples,
                                  boolean useDefaultMouseListeners,
                                  boolean colored,
                                  boolean log,
                                  java.awt.Dimension componentSize,
                                  int windowLength,
                                  int windowShift,
                                  java.lang.String windowType,
                                  boolean averaged)
constructor

Parameters:
bas - reference to global audio file storage
contrast -
fromSample - the first sample, starting point
nSamples - how many samples should be read
useDefaultMouseListeners - use built-in mouse-listeners (zooming, dragging, etc. try out!)
colored - start with a colored spectrogram
log - use logScale
componentSize - startSize of JComponent (setPreferredSize(..))
windowLength - length of the window in ms
windowShift - shift of the window in ms
windowType - hamm|hann|rect
averaged - use average "interpolation"

setDataRange

public void setDataRange(int fromSample,
                         int nSamples)
sets the data range (or "zoom" as declared in interface Visualizer) to be shown in the current spectrogram
fits into the given frame-"raster"
automatically calls computeAndRepaintSpectrogram()

Parameters:
fromSample - start sample
nSamples - how many samples to be shown on the image

public void repaintAndUpdateImage()
call this function if you want only want to update the image, without recomputation of the spectrogram data

public void computeAndRepaintSpectrogram()
